info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 13 at 5:39PM EDT until July 13 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...Portions of central and south central Virginia, including the following county and independent cities, in central Virginia, City of Colonial Heights. In south central Virginia, City of Petersburg and Prince George.
* WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding, especially in Old Town Petersburg, and portions of the city of Colonial Heights. Some low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Local media have reported water rescues.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain due to thunderstorms has led to flooding across the area that will continue this evening. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen earlier today. Additional rainfall is possible later this evening, though this remains uncertain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Petersburg, Colonial Heights, Fort Gregg-Adams, Ettrick and Petersburg National Battlefield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Prince George, VA; City of Colonial Heights, VA; City of Petersburg, VA
